sun.name: Sun
sun.description: The central star of the solar system, a massive ball of hot plasma that provides light and energy to the planets.

mercury.name: Mercury
mercury.description: The smallest planet in the solar system, with a barren and rocky surface. It experiences extreme temperature variations.

venus.name: Venus
venus.description: Known as Earth's 'sister planet,' Venus has a thick atmosphere that traps heat, making it the hottest planet in the solar system.

earth.name: Earth
earth.description: The only known planet to support life, Earth has a diverse ecosystem and a complex climate system.

earthMoon.name: Moon
earthMoon.description: Earth's natural satellite, the Moon plays a significant role in Earth's tides and has been a subject of human exploration.

mars.name: Mars
mars.description: Often called the 'Red Planet,' Mars has a thin atmosphere and features like valleys, polar ice caps, and the tallest volcano in the solar system.

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.description: The largest planet in the solar system, Jupiter is a gas giant with a strong magnetic field and a complex system of colorful bands and zones.

saturn.name: Saturn
saturn.description: Famous for its stunning ring system, Saturn is another gas giant with a unique appearance that makes it easily recognizable.

uranus.name: Uranus
uranus.description: Uranus is an ice giant with a blue-green color due to the presence of methane in its atmosphere. It rotates on its side compared to other planets.

neptune.name: Neptune
neptune.description: Neptune is another ice giant, known for its striking deep blue color. It has the strongest winds in the solar system and a series of dark spots.
